statement.p: Find a matrix that is similar to the matrix A=\mat{1 2;3 4}
If A is similar to B, and B is similar to C, are A and C also similar? If A and B are similar, are A^k and B^k also similar?

[MIT OCW] Let B be an invertible matrix, such that C=B\inv AB. A and C are similar matrices. Show that the converse is false, i.e., if A and C have same eigen values then there may not be a matrix B such that C=B\inv AB.

[MIT OCW] We say that A and B are similar matrices if A=SBS\inv for some invertible matrix S. Are the following TRUE or FALSE? Give a reason:
If A and B are similar, then A-5I and B-5I are similar.
If A and B are similar, then A^T and B^T are similar.
If A and B are similar, then AB and BA are similar.

ol.li: True. A = SBS\inv So, A^T = (S\inv)^T B^T S^T = (S^T)\inv B^T S^T
True. A=SBS\inv \implies AS = SB S(BA)S\inv = (SB)AS\inv = ASAS\inv = AB
